posts.post_content:
The best combo I can come up with is:  
  
T1: [Shuko](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shuko) ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)  
T2: [Cephalid Illusionist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cephalid Illusionist) ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)  
T3: [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) + [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe) (or wait a turn)  
  
Low, flexible mana costs, all in the same color. The cards are cheap too ($0.19 for the Cephalid, $0.49 for Shuko, $1.00 for Laboratory Maniac at the time of this post).
posts.html:
The best combo I can come up with is:

T1: Shuko
T2: Cephalid Illusionist
T3: Laboratory Maniac + Gitaxian Probe (or wait a turn)

Low, flexible mana costs, all in the same color. The cards are cheap too ($0.19 for the Cephalid, $0.49 for Shuko, $1.00 for Laboratory Maniac at the time of this post).

Posted By: Kirbster (10/6/2011 10:34:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
When you burn someone to death, you get an image of your opponent being immolated.  
When you kill someone with a creature, you think of them getting mauled.  
When you mill yourself out, the game ends, the screen turns to black,  
  
and all you hear is maddening laughter...  
  
Its the things you don't see that scare you the most.
posts.html:

and all you hear is maddening laughter...

Its the things you don't see that scare you the most.

Worried by instant-speed removal? Then [Chromatic Sphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chromatic Sphere) is here for the rescue and the win!  
  
None can respond to winning with this mana ability. Not even with [Wipe Away](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wipe Away). Actually, you can even win while [Wipe Away](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wipe Away) is still on the stack.

posts.post_content:
I use this in my [Primal Surge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Surge) EDH deck. The deck has no sorceries or instants so I play my entire deck when it's cast. This card is a back-up so they can't just force a card draw to kill me.   
  
I'm looking forward to the day where someone misses that I played this card (Most of the time they aren't going to look through the 50+ creatures that are played) and try to deck me only to accidentally make me win.

Posted By: Moxxy (11/29/2013 3:43:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I was really sad that Lab Maniac wasn't a legendary creature. Geralf could've been a great candidate.   
  
He was some kind of scientist, he was affiliated with Blue ([Geralf's Mindcrusher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geralf's Mindcrusher)) as well as Black, and if you read [Rooftop Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rooftop Storm)'s flavour text, you'll understand that he has a Dr.Frankenstein-esque assistant. Not only that, but Maniac is pulling a lever in this art, and lightning is shooting everywhere. It's almost as if he was in the middle of a storm.... hmm...  
  
But then I thought about it: How many effects empty your library? [Leveler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leveler), [Mirror-Mad Phantasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror-Mad Phantasm)+[Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone)... Allowing a legendary card to have this ability is just... unacceptable.
posts.html:
I was really sad that Lab Maniac wasn't a legendary creature. Geralf could've been a great candidate.

He was some kind of scientist, he was affiliated with Blue (Geralf's Mindcrusher) as well as Black, and if you read Rooftop Storm's flavour text, you'll understand that he has a Dr.Frankenstein-esque assistant. Not only that, but Maniac is pulling a lever in this art, and lightning is shooting everywhere. It's almost as if he was in the middle of a storm.... hmm...

But then I thought about it: How many effects empty your library? Leveler, Mirror-Mad Phantasm+Clone... Allowing a legendary card to have this ability is just... unacceptable.

posts.post_content: [Paradigm Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradigm Shift) with an empty or almost-empty graveyard is the most lightweight way to pull him off. iUseBreakOpen's combo is improved by going turn 1 [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe), turn 2 shift, turn 3 draw the probe as your last card, cast maniac, cast probe. One less card, and any one-cost spell whatsoever will do for the first one if you're willing/able to wait a turn. Of course, the sensible thing to do is run both combos
posts.html:
Paradigm Shift with an empty or almost-empty graveyard is the most lightweight way to pull him off. iUseBreakOpen's combo is improved by going turn 1 Gitaxian Probe, turn 2 shift, turn 3 draw the probe as your last card, cast maniac, cast probe. One less card, and any one-cost spell whatsoever will do for the first one if you're willing/able to wait a turn. Of course, the sensible thing to do is run both combos

Posted By: LordRandomness (8/27/2013 1:52:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's an incredibly banned deck, but:  
  
Decklist:  
Playsets of [Darkpact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darkpact), [Timmerian Fiends](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timmerian Fiends), [Tempest Efreet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tempest Efreet), [Rebirth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rebirth), [Jeweled Bird](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jeweled Bird), [Demonic Attorney](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Attorney), [Contract From Below](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contract From Below), [Bronze Tablet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bronze Tablet), and [Amulet of Quoz](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Quoz).  
  
2 [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac)  
2 [Shuko](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shuko)  
2 [Cephalid Illusionist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cephalid Illusionist)  
4 [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe)  
4 [Street Wraith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Street Wraith)  
11 [Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Island)  
  
Basically exile the first bunch of cards (36 cards) from your deck. The Gitaxian Probe and Street Wraith both let you draw a card for 2 life, so your deck is basically:   
  
2 Lab Maniac  
2 Shuko  
2 Cephalid Illusionist  
10 Island.
posts.html:
It's an incredibly banned deck, but:

Decklist:
Playsets of Darkpact, Timmerian Fiends, Tempest Efreet, Rebirth, Jeweled Bird, Demonic Attorney, Contract From Below, Bronze Tablet, and Amulet of Quoz.

2 Laboratory Maniac
2 Shuko
2 Cephalid Illusionist
4 Gitaxian Probe
4 Street Wraith
11 Island

Basically exile the first bunch of cards (36 cards) from your deck. The Gitaxian Probe and Street Wraith both let you draw a card for 2 life, so your deck is basically:

2 Lab Maniac
2 Shuko
2 Cephalid Illusionist
10 Island.
